comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: From Wiki Sir Charles Hepburn-Johnston GCMG (11 March 1912 – 23 April 1986) was a senior British diplomat. He was born in London, the son of Ernest Johnston and Emma Hepburn, on 11 March 1912. He was educated at Winchester, and Balliol College, Oxford, joining the Diplomatic Service in 1936. He was appointed Third Secretary in Tokyo 1939-1941; First Secretary in Cairo 1945-1948; and Madrid 1948-1955; Head of the China and Korea Department 1952-1954; and Counsellor in Bonn 1954-1955. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Hepburn_Johnston

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Cassies grandma, I don't think it can be that Sir Charles Johnston because of the dates. My guess is that this is the Sir Charles Johnston who was Lord Mayor of London in 1914. According to the NYT of December 20, 1914, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E03E3DE103EE733A... he had crossed the Atlantic seventy-eight times!! At the time he was 66 -- and so the age seems reasonable. This photo is surely on a ship.
